meanings.definition: Extremely unattractive or unpleasant in appearance.
meanings.sent1: The old, torn couch in the waiting room was so fugly.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned house on the corner looked really fugly.
meanings.sent3: The bright pink and neon green color combination on the car was truly fugly.
meanings.sent4: The foggy morning made the city skyline appear fugly and distorted.
meanings.sent5: The Halloween costume was intentionally made to look fugly for the contest.

meanings.definition: To describe something as both ugly and repulsive.
meanings.sent1: She didn't hold back and openly fugly criticized the new painting.
meanings.sent2: He tends to fugly comment on everything he dislikes.
meanings.sent3: The way she would fugly mock his taste in music was quite mean.
meanings.sent4: The movie review was so harsh, it fugly tore apart the film's plot.
meanings.sent5: The chef would never fugly insult a customer's choice of dish.
